page.title: 03Education in Lorton
page.content: The primary school at present has a roll of 48 boys and girls aged 4 - 11. Following county policy there is only one intake of children in September. Children from Loweswater, Buttermere, Embleton and Wythop are brought in by mini-bus. There are 2 full time and 1 part time teachers plus secretarial help midday cum kitchen assistant and caretaker. Numbers will probably decline gradually over the next few years to be mid 30's since more leave at 11 each year than start at 4. Nearly all children go to Cockermouth School at 11 an odd one goes to Keswick School. The school has a board of Governors. There is no P.T.A. but parents are very supportive in any fund raising which must be done to maintain funds. Several children from the area go to junior schools in other towns.
